Medical training, of necessity, over-represents unusual medical conditions. There are lots of unusual medical conditions, and trainees need to see at least a reasonable sampling of them. It is proverbial that new doctors tend to over-classify in favour of unusual medical conditions: in the 1940's [a medical professor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zebra_(medicine)) said *"When you hear hoofbeats behind you, don't expect to see a zebra."*
